item.title: Using Docker for R
item.description: I had partitioned my development environment such that I had virtual machines providing: R and R-studio A PostgreSQL server A development machine This basically avoided some package clashes when “tinkering”. There is however some clumsiness (I need lots of PostgreSQL clients all over the place). So the current cunning plan is to run some of this inside Docker. The first step was adding a GPG key and the docker repositories.

item.title: Static Websites with Hugo and R-Blogdown
item.description: The current iteration of this website is a static website based on Hugo. In my opinion, there is a lot to like about static websites. I have previously used Jekyll and once upon a time coded html manually. However, modern static website generators allow a wonderful presentation. The currently styling is based upon the Terrassa theme; for me it scored highly for accessibility and mobile friendliness. The bigger issue for me though is to do data and version controlling.
